translated: Kulla went to the charnel ground
and saw a woman who had died,
thrown out in the charnel ground,

original: khajjantiṁ kimihī phuṭaṁ.🔽Āturaṁ asuciṁ pūtiṁ,🔽passa kulla samussayaṁ;
analyzed: khajjantim kimihī phuṭa  āturam asucim pūti  passa kulla samussaya
translated: being eaten by worms and maggots.🔽See, Kulla, this bloated body,🔽sickly, impure, and stinking,
Having taken up the mirror of the Dhamma
for the attainment of knowledge and vision,

analyzed: tuccham santara bāhira  yathā idam tathā eta
translated: empty inside and out.🔽As it is, so it is;🔽as it is, so it is.

original: yathā etaṁ tathā idaṁ;🔽Yathā adho tathā uddhaṁ,
analyzed: yathā etam tathā  yathā adho tathā uddha

original: yathā uddhaṁ tathā adho.🔽Yathā divā tathā rattiṁ,
analyzed: yathā uddham tathā adhas  yathā divā tathā
translated: as above, so below.🔽As by day, so at night;
as at night, so by day.
as when the mind is unified
and one truly sees the Dhamma.”
